{"step_by_step_thinking": "Vedolizumab is a medication used to treat inflammatory bowel disease. It is a monoclonal antibody, which are large molecules that do not typically pass into breast milk in significant amounts. Additionally, even if small amounts were to pass into breast milk, they would likely be destroyed in the infant's gastrointestinal tract and not absorbed. Therefore, it is unlikely that therapeutic levels of Vedolizumab can be found in the breast milk of nursing mothers following treatment for Inflammatory bowel disease.", "answer_choice": "B. no"}
